isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - CAB: 5000, 9100, 9200, 9300, 9400 - REMOVE AND INSTALL - OUTER DOOR HANDLE

svcprocinfo.para: The outer door handle ( Item 3, Figure 66) is a combination handle and lever. It is connected by control rods to the latch assembly mechanism, and actuates the latch jaws. You can remove the outer door handle without removing the latch assembly.

step1.para: Remove the window regulator handle, grab handle, ash receptacle (right door only), and door check strap from the lower door cover panel.
Remove the retaining screws from the lower door cover panel, disconnect electrical connectors, if so equipped, and remove the panel.

caution.para: To prevent damage to the door while fully open, re-install the door check strap.

step1.para: Detach the door latch control rod ( Item 3, Figure 64) and lock control rod ( Item 2, Figure 64) from the outer handle ( Item 4, Figure 64).

Remove the four hex nuts ( Item 3, Figure 65) on the inside of the door to release the outer door handle ( Item 3, Figure 66). Remove the window stop on the inside of the door, and remove the outer door handle.
Position the outer door handle on the outer door panel, install the window stop on the inside of the door and fasten the outer door handle with the four nuts.
Attach the door latch control rod and lock control rod to the handle.
Remove the door check strap from the door temporarily to allow the lower door cover panel to be put back onto the door.
Position the lower door cover panel in place and reconnect electrical connectors, if so equipped, and secure with the mounting screws.
Install the window regulator handle, ash receptacle (right door only), grab handle, and door check strap to the lower door cover panel.
